page.title: 07Gas
page.content: The{gas works}come from the North Sea and it goes to Easington and after it goes to Easington it goes through Paull and after it has been through Paull it goes to Hull and Beverley.The {gas works}look like alot of pipes and tubes.The pipes are long and round. The{gas}is underground in the pipes to Hull and Beverley. All the other places where it goes are small sites. The{gas works}are near the farm. Lakes farm is the farm where the{gas mains } go through. The reason we don't have{gas}in Paull is because the pressure of the gas is too high for us.It would cost hundreds and thousands of pounds to get the gas down to the right pressure for the people of Paull to use. Twenty people take it in turns to come out to the terminal to check on the{gas.
